topics.body:
Just a bit of politics, but the non-controversial type; I know it's my own personal opinion and such, but I think I know why the anti-glbt movement just won't give up when it comes to marriage.

Currently around 30% of the usa is against same sex marriage and that; the thing is though that if you break it down 6% of the population is only slightly against it (aka the "voters should vote on it instead of the judicial system deciding" crowd) and the rest of those that do are for multiple reasons.

Purely theoretical here, but I think the reason why they're trying to stall for as much time as possible isn't because they hope to turn it back but because in the states that have legalized gay marriage over time there's less and less resistance to it.  Essentially if gay marriage is completely legalized they know that support for their cause will slowly slip away.  It's not that much of a stretch to assume that 6% that only oppose it cause they think it should be done through voting will start slipping into the "I don't care" crowd and that.  I would not be surprised if in say five or so years only somewhere in the ballpark of 15% to 20% of the usa is against same sex marriage cause 30%-6% = around 24% and probably opposition to same sex marriage will continue to dwindle until only the fanatics are left.

Essentially: they know that they can't win, they're just trying to cling onto having their morals stay popular for as long as they possibly can.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Don't take this the wrong way, *BUT* speaking from personal experience people with your sort of mentality are incredibly easy to get in bed because they have no real sort of emotional resistance to someone actually trying to have sex with them.


What I mean by this is that there's a difference between saying what you'll do in a situation where someone offers to have sex with you and what you would actually do if someone were to offer to have sex with you.  *Most* of the time the people that go "I'm waiting to find true love" whenever someone does try to seduce them the whole "I'm waiting for true love" goes right out of the window.

Tl:dr; "I'm waiting for true love!"
*Other person uses "It's getting hot in here"*
*IT'S SUPER EFFECTIVE!*

Which scenario would you find harder to resist?
Someone offering you dinner.
Someone getting you so hot and bothered that you legitimately can't think straight and need to run to the bathroom right that instant.
